title: Faulty and inconsistent
body:
Warily ordered this after seeing mixed reviews, but decided it was worth a try, considering the price. Arrived quickly and was very simple to set up (despite instructions not written in English).
Whilst being made mostly of plastic, the machine admittedly does look nice and is compact enough to fit on most countertops.
I did really want to like this machine and prove its critics wrong, however, it simply has too many faults.
In order to make a drink, the machine needs to heat up, which either takes 30 seconds or 30 minutes and is really inconsistent (often it will turn itself off in the process as well).
The portafilter does not easy lock into place and so is necessary to hold the machine to stabilise it whilst doing so (making the cup warmer on top, very risky). When pouring a shot, you must manually stop the water as it does not automatically shut off based on shot volume. Whilst this is typical of machines in this price range, without purchasing shot glasses to measure, it can lead to very watery, undrinkable espresso. Due to inconsistency with water temperature, pressurised coffee baskets and a plastic tamp, it is really difficult to get a nice crema on your shots and therefore hard to call anything this machine actually produces, espresso.
It also does not include a milk jug (I did purchase a 350ml jug, which fits perfectly). Whilst the steam wand does extend outwards, it is not very long so would not recommend a milk jug any larger. The steam wand is also really inconsistent and takes a long time to heat the milk to a temperature considered worthy of drinking (65 degrees ish). Often it will just push water into the milk despite the green light indicating ideal temperature for steaming.
I have made a few nice coffees from this machine, but really is not worth the trouble when just as many get thrown down the sink.
It is easy to clean and the drip tray removes to place large mugs underneath the portafilter.
I have had this machine less than a week and it is already packing up, lights no longer working, refusing to steam and made a worrying sounding bang. Will be returning asap.

body:

title: Overwhelmingly blah
body:
I wouldn't recommend you buy this at full price, it definitely wasn't even worth the Amazon Warehouse price I paid for it.

Yes, it does make coffee most of the time. However it doesn't make it very quickly as it takes its sweet time indicating 'ok', and you have to stand next to it and time it yourself with a watch as it doesn't stop after xx ml of water has been sent through for single or double shot. Which would be a sort of bare minimum mechanic on a triple digit priced cappuccino maker, in my opinion. If you want a double shot good luck fitting 18 grams in there without having to be two people to tamper it down and getting it on. If you use finer ground coffee in order to fit 18 grams without getting tennis elbow, it'll be too packed so it blocks the holes and the machine will struggle to brew anything at all. I stood there for 30 seconds whilst nothing but loud rumbling was happening, I had to just turn it off as I was afraid the machine would break if I left it any longer.

If you want lovely frothy milk you can have a lot of it and feel like a proper barista as the milk stretches to reveal a beautiful silky froth. OR you can have the machine violently fling the nozzle off and splash down in your milk. You never know which is going to happen so just make sure you aren't in your Sunday finest. I use a kitchen towel to hold the base of the nozzle in place when I purge it to test if it's coming off or not. Sometimes it tricks me and comes flying off anyway when I take the towel off.

I don't know if I just got a dud product or if this is to be expected with all of them. Didn't fit my expectations at all for the brand and price I paid, I have a serious case of buyer's remorse and wouldn't buy again or recommend. I am sure you can get the exact same machine for half the price with a differrent logo on it. Honestly buy a more expensive Delonghi one if you want a quality one, not this.
